result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Deterick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael J Deterick is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael J Deterick was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: If fully compliant with probation, agent's approval, no new crimes rising to p/c or ATR's, probation can terminate after 18 mo.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $443  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JC.

Abide by injunction in 15CV2635.  Completion of certified domestic violence treatment.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Civil filing fee purs to sec 814.61(1)(d) & (e) & service fee purs to sec 814.70(1) from case 15CV2635.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

Atty DJ Klauser
Referral to Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM)
Preliminary hearing at 11-10-2015 02:30 pm

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Jamie C.
- Defendant shall not be in the 6200 block of Putnam Rd in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall abide by the Injunction issued in Dane County Case No. 2015CV2635.
- The court orders a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $3000.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 2

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Stephanie R Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
signed PC's
